content.text:
# List of wars involving Paraguay__disambig_1

This is a list of wars involving the Republic of Paraguay from 1810 to the present day.
{| class="wikitable"
|-
! style="background:#0000FF; width:200px;"|Conflict
! style="background:#0000FF; width:160px;"|Combatant 1
! style="background:#0000FF; width:160px;"|Combatant 2
! style="background:#0000FF; width:300px;"|Result
! style="background:#0000FF; width:300px;"|President
|-
|style="background:#efefef"| Paraguayan Campaign(1810–1811)
|style="background:#efefef"|  Spanish Empire
* Intendancy of Paraguay
|style="background:#efefef"|
|style="background:#D0FFD0"| Victory
*Paraguay retains independence from the Revolutionary Primera Junta of Buenos Aires
*Paraguay would obtain independence from Spain afterwards
|style="background:#efefef"| }}
|-
|style="background:#efefef"| Battle of Candelaria(1815)
|style="background:#efefef"| Paraguay
|style="background:#efefef"|
|style="background:#FFD0D0"| Defeat
*Paraguayan invasion repelled
|style="background:#efefef" rowspan=3| }}
|-
|style="background:#efefef"| Paraguayan Incursion in Corrientes(1821–1823)
|style="background:#efefef"| Paraguay
|style="background:#efefef"|
|style="background:#D0FFD0"| Victory
*Paraguay seizes territory from Corrientes
|-
|style="background:#efefef"| Correntine-Paraguayan War(1833)
|style="background:#efefef"| Paraguay
|style="background:#efefef"|
|style="background:#D0FFD0"| Victory
*Paraguay slightly expands its territory in Corrientes and Misiones
|-
|style="background:#efefef"| Platine War(1845–1852)}}
|style="background:#efefef"|  Argentine Rebels
|style="background:#efefef"|
|style="background:#D0FFD0"| Victory
*Paraguay occupies the Misiones Province
*Juan Manuel de Rosas overthrown by the Allied Forces led by Brazil
*Argentine Confederation recognizes the Independence of Paraguay, with Brazilian support
*Brazilian hegemony in the Platine region starts
|style="background:#efefef"|
|-
|style="background:#efefef"| Paraguayan War(1864–1870)
|style="background:#efefef"|
|style="background:#efefef"|
|style="background:#FFD0D0"| Defeat
*Allied occupation of Paraguay
*Paraguay lost approx. 33% of territory to the Allied Powers; around 50% of the Paraguayan population died during the war
*Postwar decade of severe social crisis, political inestability and constant rebellions in 1870 - 1879
|style="background:#efefef"|
|-
|style="background:#efefef"| Caballero's revolts(1873-1874)
|style="background:#efefef"|
Support:
*
|style="background:#efefef"| Bernardino Caballero and other Lopiztas
Support:
*
|style="background:#FFD0D0"| Government Defeat
*Rebels topple the Jovellanos cabinet, forcing Benigno Ferreira and others into exile
*Brazil imposes Juan Bautista Gill as next president
|style="background:#efefef"|
|-
|style="background:#efefef"| Commander Molas' revolt(1874)
|style="background:#efefef"|
|style="background:#efefef"| José Dolores MolasArmed peasants
|style="background:#D0FFD0"| Government Victory
*Brazilian troops force rebels to disperse
*Gill's government loses legitimacy due to its failure against the rebels
|style="background:#efefef" rowspan=2|
|-
|style="background:#efefef"| General Serrano's revolt(1874)
|style="background:#efefef"|
|style="background:#efefef"| German SerranoArmed peasants
|style="background:#D0FFD0"| Government Victory
*Rebels defeated
*General Serrano executed after battle
|-
|style="background:#efefef"| 1877 uprising(1877)
|style="background:#efefef"|
|style="background:#efefef"| Cirilo Antonio Rivarola loyalists
|style="background:#D0FFD0"| Government Victory
*Rebels defeated
*President Gill assassinated
*Start of General Caballero's hegemony over Paraguayan politics
|style="background:#efefef"|
|-
|style="background:#efefef"| Juan Silvano Godoi's revolt(1879)
|style="background:#efefef"|
|style="background:#efefef"| Juan Silvano Godoi and allies
Support:
*
|style="background:#D0FFD0"| Government Victory
*Argentine Navy forces rebels to sail back to Buenos Aires
|style="background:#efefef"|
|-
|style="background:#efefef"| Liberal uprising(1891)
|style="background:#efefef"|  Colorado Party
|style="background:#efefef"|  Liberal Party
|style="background:#D0FFD0"| Government Victory
*Rebels defeated
*Start of Juan Bautista Egusquiza's political rise
|style="background:#efefef"|
|-
|style="background:#efefef"| Liberal Revolution(1904)
|style="background:#efefef"|  Caballerist Colorados
|style="background:#efefef"|  Liberal Party Egusquicista Colorados
|style="background:#FFD0D0"| Government Defeat
*Rebels overthrow the Escurra government
*Liberal Regime established until 1936
*Paraguayan Army disbanded and then rebuilt based on rebel forces
|style="background:#efefef"|
|-
|style="background:#efefef"| First Paraguayan Civil War(1911–1912)
|style="background:#efefef"|  Radical Liberals
|style="background:#efefef"|  Civic Liberals Colorado Party
|style="background:#FFD0D0"|Government Defeat
*Eduardo Schaerer becomes the 25th president of Paraguay
|style="background:#efefef"|
|-
|style="background:#efefef"| Second Paraguayan Civil War(1922-1923)
|style="background:#efefef"|   Saco Puku Liberals
|style="background:#efefef"|  Saco Mbyky Liberals
|style="background:#D0FFD0"| Government Victory
*Defeat of the supporters of Eduardo Schaerer, known as the "Saco Mbyky" side
*Consolidation of the faction of Manuel Gondra and Eusebio Ayala, known as the "Saco Puku" side
|style="background:#efefef" rowspan=2|
|-
|style="background:#efefef"| Chaco War(1932–1935)
|style="background:#efefef"|
|style="background:#efefef"|
|style="background:#D0FFD0"| Victory
*Most of the disputed area awarded to Paraguay.
|-
|style="background:#efefef"| World War II(1945)
|style="background:#efefef"| and others
|style="background:#efefef"| and others
|style="background:#D0FFD0"| Victory
*Collapse of the German Reich
*Fall of Japanese and Italian Empires
*Creation of the United Nations
*Emergence of the United States and the Soviet Union as superpowers
*Beginning of the Cold War
|style="background:#efefef" rowspan=2|
|-
|style="background:#efefef"| Third Paraguayan Civil War(1947)
|style="background:#efefef"|  Moríñigo Government Colorado PartySupported by:
|style="background:#efefef"|  Liberal Party Revolutionary Febrerista Party Paraguayan Communist Party
|style="background:#D0FFD0"| Government Victory
*Liberal Party definitely overthrown from power
*Colorado Party returns to political power since 1947 - 1948
*Colorado Hegemony established until 2008
|-
|style="background:#efefef"| Guerrillas against Stroessner(1958–1980)
|style="background:#efefef"| Supported by:
|style="background:#efefef"|  Paraguayan Revolutionary Guerrillas:
|style="background:#D0FFD0"| Government Victory
*President Alfredo Stroessner remains in power and suppresses all insurrections
*Severe human rights violations caused by Stroessner's regime
|style="background:#efefef" rowspan=2|
|-
|style="background:#efefef"| Dominican Civil War(1965–1966)
|style="background:#efefef"|
|style="background:#efefef"|
|style="background:#D0FFD0"| Victory
*Juan Bosch excluded from Presidency, election of Joaquín Balaguer
|-
|style="background:#efefef"| Insurgency In Paraguay(2005–present)
|style="background:#efefef"|
*Armed forces
*Police
*Joint Task Force (FTC)
Supported by:

Justicieros de la Frontera
|style="background:#efefef"|  Paraguayan People's Army (EPP) Armed Peasant Association (ACA) but was revived sometime in 2017 by members of the EML. }} Army of Marshal López (EML)(from 2016)Supported by: FARC (until 2016) Manuel Rodríguez Patriotic Front (alleged) Primeiro Comando da CapitalComando Vermelho
